intro: Veronica francispetae, commonly known as the Santa Cruz veronica, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the plantain family, Plantaginaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral. It is a perennial herb that produces small, oval leaves and is often found in the Santa Cruz Mountains. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
